Thyroid.Description: Most grossly non-nodular normal regions from either side (whichever side is observed to be more normal).

Testis.Description: Left testis (and right testis if necessary to obtain sufficient tissue for aliquots).

Small_Intestine_Terminal_Ileum.Description: Thickened mucosa corresponding to lymphoid nodules (Peyer Patches) just proximal to the ileocecal valve in the most distal part of the small intestine.
Small_Intestine_Terminal_Ileum.Notes: Separate the mucosa with submucosa from the muscularis propria, discarding the latter. The area with the most lymphoid tissue has a nodular or even polypoid surface. Cleaving or scraping the mucosa/submucosa off the muscularis with a scalpel blade at a 45 degree angle may be helpful.
Small_Intestine_Terminal_Ileum.Tissue: Lymphoid tissue of terminal ileum (Peyer Patches)

Artery_Aorta.Description: Ascending aorta or other thoracic regions (nonatherosclerotic).

Whole_Blood.Description: Femoral vein; subclavian vein and heart are other possible sites.
Whole_Blood.Notes: (Preference of location will vary for organ donors [beating heart donors (usually arterial line)] vs. non-beating heart tissue donors (venous route)."

Breast_Mammary_Tissue.Description: Central breast subareolar region of the right breast, 1-2 cm under the skin surface of nipple region.

Minor_Salivary_Gland.Notes: Evert the lower lip and, using a chalazion clamp (if available), make a 10 mm long and 5 mm deep incision of the inner surface of the lip. Trim off adjacent adipose tissue and lip surface. (Avoid incising full thickness, to the skin inferior to the lower lip resulting in a cosmetic defect.)

Adrenal_Gland.Description: Left, followed by the right if necessary for sufficient aliquots.

Stomach.Notes: Rinse mucosa with normal saline before aliquot preparation

Esophagus_Muscularis.Description: Squamous region (distal/lower third), at least 4 cm above gastroesophageal junction.

Liver.Description: Central right lobe, 1 cm below capsule.

Muscle_Skeletal.Description: The gastrocnemius muscle, 2 cm below the patella.

Pancreas.Notes: Avoid large blood vessels and ducts.

Adipose_Subcutaneous.Description: Subcutaneous tissue beneath the leg's skin sample.

Esophagus_Gastroesophageal_Junction.Description: Muscularis propria in the lowest portion of the esophagus just proximal to the stomach.

Heart_Left_Ventricle.Description: Anterior left ventricle, 1 cm above apex and 1 cm from left anterior descending coronary artery.
Heart_Left_Ventricle.Notes: Other Sampling Site: Right atrial appendage, tip.

Uterus.Description: Corpus. Bivalve uterus along endocervical canal to fundus.

Ovary.Description: Most normal regions of the left ovary (and right if necessary to obtain sufficient aliquots).

Artery_Coronary.Description: Left and right, noncalcific regions only.

Adipose_Visceral_Omentum.Description: Adipose tissue on the large fold of parietal peritoneum that hangs down from the greater curvature of the stomach, passing in front of the small intestines.

Esophagus_Mucosa.Description: Squamous region (distal/lower third), at least 4 cm above gastroesophageal junction.
Esophagus_Mucosa.Notes: Getting well above the GE junction avoids the area of most gastric reflux and hiatal hernias. Avoid the midesophagus, where skeletal muscle is found.

Skin_Not_Sun_Exposed_Suprapubic.Description: Extension of the abdominal incision to the suprapubic area avoiding pubic hair.
Skin_Not_Sun_Exposed_Suprapubic.Notes: Visible antiseptic should be gently removed with an alcohol swab.

Lung.Description: Inferior segment of left upper lobe, 1 cm below the pleural surface.
Lung.Notes: If this region is grossly abnormal, select the aliquots from a grossly normal region in any lobe, excluding the right middle lobe. Avoid any large arteries, veins, and bronchi.

Colon_Transverse.Notes: Gently rinse mucosa with normal saline before aliquot preparation. Aliquots should contain the full thickness of the colonic wall, i.e., mucosa and muscularis propria. Trim adjacent adipose tissue

Skin_Sun_Exposed_Lower_leg.Description: Left or right leg 2 cm below patella on medial side.
Skin_Sun_Exposed_Lower_leg.Notes: If not available, an "other" location should be chosen.
